title: Jamestown70
author: Jamestown70
content: I want to understand something about this forum concerning merit, will the amount of activity somebody have translate to merit anytime or it all depends on the one given to you by somebody?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Activities will not be used to be given you merits.The merits given you are the merits that you have. Only people that activities were used to be given merit was when merit system was introduced when the merits and smerits were airdropped by theymos.Read what established members are posting than you posting. Make your post be like you are communicating, with useful posts. Also you can come up with topics that you think can be helpful and benefiting.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Activity can never be converted to merit, nor will merit be converted to activity, but merit and activity are very vital for ranking up, as they both work hand in hand in order for you to obtain a new rank, so you need both to qualify for whatever rank you desire. Activity happens to be updated from your posts made in your account, and it's updating 14 activities every 14 days. No matter the number of posts that you make, only 14 posts will be converted to activity every 14 days. In that way, the merit system is to separate those who shitpost from those who make quality posts, as you need to make something meaningful either as a reasonable question or contribute positively in order to earn some merit, which will qualify you to gain a new rank. Like Charles said, it was in the past before the merit system was introduced; that's when those who already had attained a certain rank were airdropped with a certain amount of merit, which could qualify them for keeping the rank active. Aside from them, there is no airdrop merit again that I have ever read off in the forum unless for the (s) merit given to the merit source.

comments.author: Antotena
comments.body: Quote from: Jamestown70 on November 12, 2023, 01:55:33 PMI want to understand something about this forum concerning merit, will the amount of activity somebody have translate to merit anytime or it all depends on the one given to you by somebody?I think you need to check this thread:  FAQ: Everything you need to know about forum 'activity, account ranks and merit, everything you need to know about forum ranking, merit system and activity need to reach there.Activity is what you get when you post and this activated in every period(14 days), when you post within this period, yout activity is going to increase which is always in between 2 weeks or 14 days. Anytime you post within this period, your will get that activity but will not increase until you post, most times when you see profiles that have activity and post the same number, is because they have been making atleast a post in this period, my profile as I'm replying you will be having 166 posts and 166 activity and that is because I have been making at least a single post in between the previous periods.Merit on the other hand is what you get when another member reward your post and for every merit you received, you can only send out half of it to another person. Meaning, when you receive 2 merit, you will have 1 Smerit to send to another users when you see their post.your ranking depends on the relationship between your merit needed and activity. For example, to be a newbie, you need to have 1 activity and zero which you already have. To get a junior member rank, you need 30 activity and 1 merit and many more to legendary rank.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: Jamestown70 on November 12, 2023, 01:55:33 PMI want to understand something about this forum concerning merit, will the amount of activity somebody have translate to merit anytime or it all depends on the one given to you by somebody?You don't grow merits mate, you earn them. And it's not possible for your activity to transform into merits. Not anymore. Since the merit system was introduced, you have to earn them by contributing quality post to the forum. Your activities counts every 14 days a total of 14, so long you create some post. If you are inactive your activity won't count.You may want to read this quote from theymos on how the merit system works.Quote from: theymos on January 24, 2018, 11:00:11 PMIn addition to activity, everyone now has a merit score, and you need both a certain activity level and a certain merit score in order to reach higher member ranks. The required scores are:RankRequired activityRequired meritBrand new00Newbie10Jr Member301Member6010Full Member120100Sr. Member240250Hero Member480500LegendaryRandom in the range 775-10301000You get merit points when someone sends you some for one of your posts. Additionally, when someone sends you merit points, half of those points can be sent by you to other people.Certain users are designated as "merit sources". They can create new merit out of nothing, up to a limited number per month (which differs per source). I will not be posting a definitive list of merit sources (so that people don't bug them too much), though you'll soon figure out who they are if you pay attention.There is currently no such thing as a "demerit". I'm hoping that the positive merits alone will be fine. I could add demerits pretty easily later on if necessary, though.

comments.author: Kelward

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: A quality post = 1 merit or more.A quality post is indeed equal to your chances of have or gaining a merit or more. The merit is being awarded to you by fellow members of this forum who found your contributions worthy enough. It is a credit you get for your efforts trying to solve problems by proffering solutions to the questions asked here.I can decide to give you a merit if I have some sMerits after you must have impressively solved my problem and that's the simple understanding of merit. the sMerit also know as sendable merit is more like 50% of merits you get starting from 2 merits since 1 merit will be half and there's not half merit in the merit system. These merits then go on to further give you leverage to rank up in the forum ranking system after you must have also attained some level of activities in the forum. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0There are a number of members on this forum who have more merits than their activities, so if an activity = merit, what would you say about those members? It is basically because they have extremely valuable quality posts which also shows their deep understanding on the subject matter.Make you try search for some of these topics for the 'search' tab, e go help you well well in understanding these basic components of the forum.

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: I don't know why you choose to ask this question here when you can do that in Beginners and help. Any way merit is easy to get, and higher rank is attainable as long as you have quality post and also quality replies. You can have a quality comment when you contribute something that was helpful, find a solution or some advice to a difficult situation/problem, disagree with someone that seems to be striking a point that is not valid especially when you have a different view on it. Merit can only be given to you by other members of the forum when they find your post or comment satisfying then it can be worth merit. OP you don't have to focus your mindset on the merit because as i know that you have the urge to rank up as fast, but it will take a little time and it is stage by stage. As you continue to progress on your rank you will find out that you have known more than you know when you initially joined the forum. Stay consistent and abide to the rules, it is the key to your success in this. forum.

comments.author: Makus
comments.body: Quote from: Jamestown70 on November 12, 2023, 01:55:33 PMI want to understand something about this forum concerning merit, will the amount of activity somebody have translate to merit anytime or it all depends on the one given to you by somebody?Activity and merit na two different things, without activity you no go fit rank up and without merit you no go still fit rank up so the two of dem dey work hand in hand no be say na the same thing. Your activities na from your accepted posts for two weeks, and na only 14 post the forum dey accept wey go come turn to activity, so inside two weeks if you post 25 things na only 14 go add up to you activity. While for your merit side na if you post something wey dey very interesting to the reader then the person fit send you merit, and mind you we still get wattin dem dey call smerit= sendable merit. So every merit wey go get the half of that number of merit go give you the sendable, so if person send you 1 merit na 1/2 go dey you smerit portfolio and if dem send you 2 na 1 go dey, just like that to any number. And the smerit you no go fit use am do any thing than to send am give person for em post wey you like.

comments.body: Surprisingly, except from @charlse-Tim, I never see other senior members turning up to answer vital question as this, Abi una believe say he suppose read am for “everything you need to know about ranks and merits ?” Well I just want let una know say, these na the necessary post wey need to show our superiority and intelligence because this post is a stranded newbie who needs direction and yet nobody except Charles showed up but only the lower ranked members helping themselves and you think is easy?I know how many people wey fit attest to the fact that I never relent on pushing their growth either with advise or otherwise and I hope we all do the same rather than wanting to police the local board for no reason.
